content.rendered:
The selections this week are so money and they don’t even know it — although they most likely do — with work from Denver, London, and Singapore.

The Nickel by The Made Shop

Located inside the Hotel Teatro in Denver, The Nickel is a restaurant offering “rustic, stripped-down Colorado fare”. Local firm The Made Shop named the restaurant — “after a giant vault we found in the basement that used to hold the tram fares: a nickel a ride” — designed its identity and along the way also redesigned the hotel’s identity and that of its lounge and coffee shop, the Barrel Bar. The Nickel work is full of perfectly crafted, old-timey design; all paying off of the building’s early nineteenth-century history. There are some really great production details throughout the project like leather coasters, tiled grills, and silkscreened burlap bags — wouldn’t mind getting caught in this place for a few rounds. See full project here.

Penny Royal Films by Alphabetical

In keeping with the coin-based theme, we turn to London’s Penny Royal Films, a production, animation, visual effects and direction agency for film, television and online. The logo, designed by local firm Alphabetical is a lovely and simple “PR” monogram inside and to stay method with the penny idea, the monogram is always printed in the actual size of a penny. In copper foil, obvs. See full project

McKILROY by &Larry

Offering menswear, McKILROY is a boutique shop in Perth, Australia, with an earthy (yet slightly off) identity by Singapore-based &Larry. What makes it slightly off is the logo, a “reconstructed hybrid of 8 sans-serif typefaces” — which is probably why I both hate it and love it. It’s off-putting yet interesting to look at. In application, the business cards and hangtags (and pretty much everything else) is covered in what looks like cheesecloth, giving it a great texture and slightly kinky aesthetic. (I don’t find cheesecloth kinky, for the record, but there is something fishnet-ey about it). And we will conclude on that weird note for the weekend. See full project.
